text: [Music]
my name is Dina for a living I'm an
agile coach and I support teams and
organizations becoming more agile
I personally believe the number one
challenge for teams they want to
implement agile is that a lot of people
have in in organizations and learned how
to work together as a team
and to overcome these challenges and
really really learn how to work together
as a team is I think one of the most
important parts of an organization
becoming agile
I think about the cause why people have
unlearned how to collaborate I think a
lot back to my school times when we
learned like you work for yourself
and you need to be better than the other
person and we you were rewarded if you
were the best or the fastest or whatever
so personally I grew up in a very
competitive environment and I see
companies have done over the last
centuries a lot to protect and grow this
competition amongst people in one
organization with the aim to have better
results but I think you get better
results if you help and support people
working together instead of working
against each other and I think we're
just relearning that collaboration and
this way of working together like
co-working is the way forward to the
future
well if companies come to us and ask us
to support them becoming more agile our
first question is why do you want that
so we're not going in saying hey we can
tell you this and that and you should do
this that but we are really trying to
understand where this idea of we need to
be more agile as coming from and then
usually we help people in the
organizations understand which kind of
methods frameworks ideas thoughts are
helping and which are hindering and we
facilitate their day to day work we do
workshops which act as like of the aha
moment of certain things to understand
even better why you can choose a
different attitude a way of looking at
things and that to me has a lot to do
with understanding what in the past we
did well and what has changed and why
these things that we made us successful
in the past nowadays are not working any
longer and why we need a different
approach and why it is worthwhile
looking into these different methods
ways of thinking ways of doing things so
that's usually the first steps we take
when we enter an organization or an
organization turns to us asking for
support
[Music]
I think a lot of companies struggle with
agile because they they've think oh that
is something you need to do now without
understanding the where the need is
coming from and what triggers that need
so the changing environments and the not
taking into consideration how long it
takes to unlearn certain behaviors this
is where I can see people struggling
because of course when we are in
stressful situations we tend to behave
the way we've learned in the past that
it was successful and we are trying to
encourage people to behave in a
different way and if there is a conflict
or a idea we are debating about not the
one who shouted shouts loudest wins but
how about listening to each other how
about considering taking an experiment
to find out better and that is for many
people in organisations counterintuitive
to what they've done over the past
decades and this unlearning part of just
leaving things behind that you've done
to be successful in the past I think
that's the this part where people
struggle most with
[Music]
I think companies are really successful
in implementing agile ways of working
what they do is they are really curious
about that they really try to find out
what is in it for me
what can we do and they are not just
debating but they are saying okay I got
this we need to do something different
and they are trying and they are
experimenting and they keep being
curious about these frameworks or
methods and about the whole mindset that
is behind agility and they have an open
mind they are not closing down too early
so yeah
